attributes.action: DECLARE THE 29TH MARCH "BREXIT DAY" AS A UK NATIONAL HOLIDAY! #BrexitDay
attributes.additional_details:
Celebrating everyone and everything that makes Great Britian and it's commonwealth great. Similar to St. George's Day, The nation will celebrate it's identity.
The day will not be made a bank holiday, but will be similar to Halloween or Bonfire Night. Fireworks could be lit at night and street parties held in the day. People could celebrate and commemorate as they go about their daily lives.
attributes.background: The UK, whatever the outcome, will be leaving the European Union on the 29th March @ 11.00pm. To commemorate & celebrate this massive event in the UK's history, the 29th March should be made a new national holiday.
